Name: The Buried City
Objectives: Say "the ancient caverns" to Guildmistress Katinallya

Guildmistress Katinallya says, "These caverns have recently been discovered by the Academy of the Arcane Sciences during a routine dig at the northern parts of the Illundium Forest. Powerful ancient beings live down there. They have made progress by the \b\ulexcavation\b0\ul0  team impossible."

Guildmistress Katinallya says, "The caverns house the buried ruins of a city, dating back to the time of the early Veratine Empire. As is common knowledge, the Veratine Empire was at it's peak 2000 years ago. However, from that time to its demise around 1000 years ago, a time of great catacylsms rocked the world. It seems that the city buried in the caverns is one of the Veratine that was buried by a massive volcanic eruption. I would like you to enter into them and to search for interesting information regarding the ancient city. I would also like you to slay a Rock Guardian and to bring back a rumored Stone Sword, for me to examine."
Guildmistress Katinallya says, "Good work [t]. I will have further instructions for you regarding research of the ancient caverns soon enough."

Guildmistress Katinallya says, "Take this necklace, I have been saving it for the best student i have ever countered. This is you, [t]. Captain Dasan says, "The guild coffers are running low. While Mayor Sedgeway can keep the city running based on the income of his shipping company, he can no longer afford to pay us what he used to for our services. Hence, we need to find an alternate source of income. I have set my eyes on the abandoned mines to the north, near Lake Conosiat. I would begin organizing a mining operating now, but there are \b\ulcomplications\b0\ul0  ."
Say "complications" to Captain Dasan

Captain Dasan says, "Indeed. Vile creatures are rumored to infest the mines. One of my excavators was killed by a Cave Goblin. Supposedly there is a camp of them, near the entrance of the mines. Go and slay their Elder, and hopefully they will fall back deeper into the mine."
Captain Dasan claps you on the back and says, "That a man, [t]. I am formulating the next plan for clearing those goblins out of the mine, check back later for details."

Name: Reclaiming the Mines, Part 2
Objectives: Say "the operation" to Captain Dasan

Captain Dasan says, "The operation is not going well, [t]. The evil creatures living in the old mines continue to hinder our efforts to get a mining team in there working. Since the death of their elder, the cave goblins have given us less of a problem, but the werebears deeper in are now acting up. Go kill their Elder, and we'll see how aggresive they are then."

Captain Dasan nods his head and then speaks, "I am impressed. The next part of the operation will begin shortly. I plan on having you lead the final attack to clear the critters from the mine. Return soon."

Name: Reclaiming the Mines, Part 3

Captain Dasan says, "Yes, there is a demon that keeps killing our soldiers that we are sending in to secure the mines. I know that it is a burden for you to have to come back from Epiach to help the guild out with this, but you are the only person who can do the job. Slay the Cave Demon, and I guarentee I shall reward you well. Good luck, [t]."

Captain Dasan grins and says, "Excellent work [t]. With that evil out the way, finally we will be able to start using the mine again. Your work here in Myronmet is done. You will now report to my superior, General Randhar, in Epiach. He will give you further assignments."

Name: The Search for Vallar
Objectives: Say "the decree" to Theolate Ho

Theolate Ho sighs and begins speaking, "As you know, back when Emperor Gregorin was still in power, he passed a decree banning worship of the gods and basically destroying the Church of Kaldana. The faithful fled to the fringes of the Empire, to places like Myronmet. Believe or not, but I was once one of the high Theolates of the Church Grand Hall. But enough reminiscing, I need you to find my old friend, Theolate Vallar, who has just escaped Epiach and is heading south on the Southern Road. Bring him this note."
Theolate Ho says, "Interesting. I know this was an easy task for you, [t], but it was essential that you accomplish this for me. Thank you."

Name: A Sad Departure
Objectives: Say "depart" to Theolate Ho

Theolate Ho claps [t] on the back and says, "[t], you have served the Church here in Myronmet well. But it is time for you to leave this place, and head to Epiach. Your services, as a Confessor of the Church, are needed. Theolate Vallar and I have been discussing important matters that are unfolding in Epiach, and we have both decided that you should take part in them. Travel north to Epiach, and speak to Vallar on your way. Ask him how you can \b\ulhelp\b0\ul0. Farewell, [t]. It has been an honor to train you."
Theolate Ho says, "Of course Sarina is impressed with me. Remember, I was once a High Theolate after all. Good luck in Epiach [t], and may the light of Aran shine upon you always."

Name: Dark Times Indeed
Objectives: Say "the exile" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina sighs and begins speaking, "Before I give your first assignment, I had better give you a bit of the history of the current situation. 60 years ago, when Emperor Gregorin passed the most unholy decree that outlawed the Church of Aran, chaos errupted in Epiach. The Church has always been strong, and we refused to abandon the great Cathedral here. However, the strong arm of the Imperial Army was too much, and we were forced to flee into the \b\ulcatacombs\b0\ul0."
Say "catacombs" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina nods and continutes speaking, "Yes, this is our sad home for the time being. I, like any Theolate, would be executed without trial if the Governors of Epiach find me. I have stayed down in this dark place for 60 long years. But now is the time that we change things. Empress Olina is not as strong as Gregorin. The Empire is crumbling around her, and now is our time to restore the light of \b\ulAran\b0\ul0 into the Majestic Empire."
Say "aran" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina continues, "Yes, may the light of Aran shine upon us all. Your task for the time being is to foster support for the Church with the farmers in the fields to the south of the city. Bring these salves of holy water to Farmer John, Pedro, and any other two farmers you come across."
Grand Theolate Sarina says, "Thank you for doing this. Come back when you have become stronger, and I will have another important task for you."

Name: Perseverance
Objectives: Say "waiting" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina shakes her fist and says, "Yes. I am sick of waiting. We sit down here in the darkness of these catacombs, but every day the world loses more and more of it's sanity. Yet we must not lose faith. This is why I need you to help us with our latest \b\ulmission\b0\ul0."
Say "mission" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina says, "The Raim river is the life blood of Epiach: for drinking water, agriculture, and even a source for the holy water of our ceremonies. A horrible demon has been defiling the sanctity of the river lately! You must track down and do away with it."
Grand Theolate Sarina says, "Good work slaying that demon, [t]. I shall have further need of your services soon."

Name: Test of Faith
Objectives: Say "test" to Grand Theolate Sarina

Grand Theolate Sarina looks resolute and says, "[t], do you truly have faith in the ultimate benevolence of Aran? The sad reality of these times is that more and more people are doubting the infallibility of Aran. With all the evils plaguing Kaldana it is hard to avoid the seeds of doubt. But as Defenders of the Faith we do not have the luxury to disbelieve. So, are you \b\ulresolute\b0\ul0 in your faith?"

Grand Theolate Sarina nods her head. "Of course you are. Now is the time for you to advance in your membership in the Church of Aran. As has been tradition for over one thousand years, you must conduct the Vigil of Sanctity. Take this page from the Book of Aran and follow the instructions. May the Light of Aran shine upon you."
Grand Theolate Sarina smiles and praises you, "Welcome back [t]. You have completed the Vigil and have passed the test. You can now prepare to join the upper ranks of the Church."

Name: Myronmet's Graveyard, Part 1

Mayor Sedgeway nods and says, "Myronmet once boasted a fine graveyard, where our dead were buried and left in peace. It was with a very heavy heart that my father had to order the graveyard closed due to Emperor Gregorin's \b\uldecree\b0\ul0 . Now the blasphemy of the Empire is biting my city in the rearend."

Mayor Sedgeway sighs. "Yes, the words that supposedly freed the Empire from the corrupt grasps of the tyrants. I say that is blasphemy, and this is why I allow the Church of Aran to remain in my city. Fortunatly Myronmet is far enough away from any real source of Imperial power for Empress Olina to take note of our transgressions. But anyway, back to the \b\ulproblem\b0\ul0 at hand".
Say "problem" to Mayor Sedgeway

Mayor Sedgesays says, "Yes! The once holy place is now crawling with evil! Please, you must go there and slay the Undead Priest that has been ressurecting the once peacefully departed dead citizens of Myronmet. I shall reward you with a most valuable artifact if you succeed. Good luck, [t]."
Mayor Sedgeway shakes your hand and says, "Well done [t]. Hopefully this will help push back the evil that is so troubling the graveyard, at least for a while"

Name: The Noble's Duty
Objectives: Say "prove" to Lord Curadis

Lord Curadis nods at you. "Yes, if you help me, you will have your new title. There is a persone who owns a small farmhouse to the south east of the city which is suffering a strange calamity. He claims raiding parties of Orcs are swiming over the Raim River and tearing apart his house, looking for something. He has been afraid to leave the city for days, because every time the orcs come they get angrier and angrier and not finding whatever it is they're searching for. I want you to go to the house and find and bring to me what it is that they are after."

Lord Curadis strokes his beard and says, "This is fascinating. That mummy I had destroyed must have been the remains of the shaman of the orc's tribe. If they are able to use magic, the city of Epiach is in for some real troubles. I thank you, [t]. You have done well. Now for a mere \cf11 400,000 \cf2 gold coins, you will have your new \b\ultitle\b0\ul0."

He has continued a stream of profanity in his communiques with my Watcher spy without any respect to myself or the order. This is unacceptable, and I want him \b\uldead\b0\ul0.
Say "dead" to Ulrad Din'arbor

Ulrad Din'arbor analyzes you and replies, "Yes. Perhaps you can assassinate him. Do it for the greater glory of nature, and for our resistance against forces that impose arbitrary dominance over beings they do not control. Be warned, this task will not be an easy one. If you succeed, I may reward you well."

Ulrad Din'arbor pulls an item out of his chest and hands it to you. "This is a charm created from the skull of the orc mages you had killed earlier. It has several unique properties that may be of assistance to you. Good work with the assassination. The war with the orcs is not over, but this battle has been clearly won."

Name: Test of Indifference
Objectives: Say "test" to Ulrad Din'arbor

Ulrad Din'arbor furls his brow and speaks, "It is time to test your commitment to the Watchers of Chaos. If you are truly one of us, you must prove your support of our creed. We watch this world with active \b\ulindifference\b0\ul0. Some call us anarchists, like that beastly man Curadis. We call ourselves seekers of balance. Unfortunately, we are not powerful enough to challenge the fools that control this world and so we can merely observe the chaos as modern events continue to spiral Kaldana towards ruin.
Say "indifference" to Ulrad Din'arbor

Ulrad Din'arbor finishes his tirade. "I need you to travel to the grave of the great druid, Uvii. 50 years ago, he had the courage to oppose the construction of the Epiach mines. He understood it would upset the balance of the area by making the citizens of Epiach too wealthy. But the Imperial administrators did not agree with his activism and they slaughtered him brutally. His shade now torments travelers along the old mountain road. Please, give him his old druid staff. Perhaps it will calm his anger."

Ulrad Din'arbor claps you on the should and offers words of encouragement. "Do not feel bad that Uvii did not like you. Hell is not a gentle place and his time there surely has colored his soul a deep shade of black. Let this be a lesson to you: the foolish actions of people are not easily undone."

Collect his skeletal head and I shall have the reagents needed for my ultimate spell."

Name: Establishing Relations
Objectives: Say "greetings" to Lord Protector Drekavorn

Lord Protector Drekavorn, regent of the Drakkari Protectorate, gets up as you enter his chambers. An eight-foot tall dragonkin, tall even for his race, he towers over you. In a deep booming voice, the Lord Protector greets you, "What an unexpected surprise. The Drakkari have not met a child of Aran in an age. I had received reports that someone had passed through the \b\ulSerpenlux\b0\ul0 gate, but did not realise them to be more than fantasy."
Say "serpenlux" to Lord Protector Drekavorn

Drekavorn nods his head. "Yes, the Serpent Queen's temple. No one has passed through it from either side since the great wars and catastrophes that ended the last age of Kaldana. But now it seems Lady Diamandia has deigned to let you through into the Dragonspire Valley - this must be a \b\ulsign\b0\ul0 from her!"
Say "sign" to Lord Protector Drekavorn

Drekavorn continues, "Indeed, and one we must heed. \cf11 Diamandia\cf2  must have determined that the time is now ripe to once again \b\ulrestore\b0\ul0 relations with humankind. Perhaps this time things will go right."
Say "restore" to Lord Protector Drekavorn

Drekavorn pulls out a massive scroll parchment and begins to write. "As \cf11 Diamandia\cf2 's chosen, I entrust you to \b\uldeliver\b0\ul0 this letter to your leaders. Unfortunately, until our relations are properly re-established, I must ask that you return here the way you came, through the Reach. I will not permit the opening of any portals and risk the safety of my people, until I know that you are a true friend of the Drakkari."
Say "deliver" to Lord Protector Drekavorn
The Lord Protector finishes the letter with a flourish, rolls and seals it, before handing it over to you.

Drekavorn says, "I commend you once again for your efforts on behalf of the Drakkari Protectorate. You may now approach any of my clergymen, who I will instruct to arrange more accomodating transport to and from Drakkarloch for you, so long as you remain a friend of our people."
Steps: Find Sealed Drakkari Communique
Give Sealed Drakkari Communique to Duke Royhelm of Atlaand
Say "seal" to Duke Royhelm of Atlaand
Say "wonder" to Duke Royhelm of Atlaand
Say "willing" to Duke Royhelm of Atlaand
Find Majestic Diplomatic Response
Give Majestic Diplomatic Response to Lord Protector Drekavorn
Say "friend" to Lord Protector Drekavorn

Name: The Thrill of the Hunt
Objectives: Say "greetings" to Lead Huntress Venatra

The Lady Venatra, Lead Huntress of the Drakefang Hunters' Guild, cuts a lithe figure as she sits at the head of a long mahogany table and tends to her equipment, restringing her ivory-white bow carved with ancient Drakkari runes. She barely looks at you as you approach, but before you can speak, she puts a finger up to silence you. Finishing with the bow, she lays it gently by her seat, and assesses you with golden eyes. Finally, she speaks, "So you're the one I've been hearing so much about. [t], was it it? Drekavorn tells me you're a friend. I will have to \b\uljudge\b0\ul0 that for myself."
Say "judge" to Lead Huntress Venatra

Venatra nods, "Correct. But more than that, I do not deal with weaklings. The Drakkari do not suffer those who cannot do their part for the homeland, and I will make no exception for you. If you seek to learn from our best, you must show us your best. Only then will I decide whether or not the children of Aran are worth dealing with in this \b\ulage\b0\ul0."
Say "age" to Lead Huntress Venatra

Venatra laughs suddenly, "What is that, how young did you think I was? Child, I have seen the fall of empires. We have the blood of \b\uldragons\b0\ul0 in our veins - and a measure of their lifespan." Venatra spreads her wings as she chuckles.
Say "dragons" to Lead Huntress Venatra
Venatra puts her arms on her hips and says, "Yes, \cf8 Kavra\cf2  herself imbued our forgotten ancestors with her magicks, and along with that her thirst for the \b\ulhunt\b0\ul0!"
Say "hunt" to Lead Huntress Venatra
Venatra licks her lips and replies, "Show equal skill to one of my hunters, and I will welcome you as one of my own. Slay the most difficult monsters in your realm, and bring me proof!"

Venatra says, "Very well. With this, I recognise your skill at the hunt and welcome you to use the full services of the Drakefang Hunters' Guild. You may approach our huntmaker below. You have managed to pique my interest, [t]. Perhaps one day we should spar, you and I." Venatra smiles to herself and returns to her seat at the head of the table.
Steps: Give unrealistically gigantic diamond to Lead Huntress Venatra
Give ancient spirit realm scroll x4 to Lead Huntress Venatra

Say "slay" to Lead Huntress Venatra

Name: Filling Drakkari Coffers
Objectives: Say "audience" to Master of Coin Telerian

The Master of Coin Telerian looks up from his opulent desk overlooking the city of Drakkarloch from his golden balcony. He puts down a pipe inlaid with gold and mother-of-pearl, and turns to you. Telerian gauges you for a second, and then speaks in a collected manner, "I was wondering when you might seek an audience. Forgive me for not reaching out first - I have been terribly \b\ulbusy\b0\ul0."
Say "busy" to Master of Coin Telerian
Telerian carries on, "Yes, it takes more than a few gold pieces to run a city of this size. Sometimes I think the \b\ulLord\b0\ul0 Protector does not always remember this." He chuckles.
Say "lord" to Master of Coin Telerian

Telerian replies, "Ah but I do not speak ill of Drekavorn. He has shepherded our people through an age of Kaldana. He is just preoccupied with more important things. Small details like how to fill our \b\ulcoffers\b0\ul0 do not bother him."
Say "coffers" to Master of Coin Telerian

Telerian shakes his ever slightly and says, "And so we come to the matter at hand. Majestic emissaries have arrived to formalize opening up \b\ultrade\b0\ul0 routes between the Protectorate and your Empire."
Say "trade" to Master of Coin Telerian

Telerian continues, "I am of two minds about this. While connecting our economies is probably an inevitability, I am wary of the power of the Majestic \b\ulcurrency\b0\ul0. There is much I do not know, and the enthusiasm with which your emissaries come to me makes me nervous."
Say "currency" to Master of Coin Telerian

Telerian looks at you directly and says, "And so I would ask you a favor, friend of the Drakkari people. If you can provide \cf3 20,000,000 gold in Majestic bullion\cf2  for the Protectorate's coffers, it would greatly shore up our economy against any financial attacks that may be lying in wait. If you can do this for us, I will personally vouch for you across all levels of Drakkari society."
Telerian smiles and says, "Thank you for your services, [t]. Allow me to give you a token of gratitude, on behalf of the Drakkari people. May the blessings of \cf3 Auriel\cf2  be upon you."
Steps: Give Gold Bar x4 to Master of Coin Telerian

Name: An Exchange of Technology
RequiredClass: Warrior Defender Assassin Paladin Redeemer Ranger
Objectives: Say "salute" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

As you enter the Office of the Battlesmith, Primurgos, a towering specimen of a dragonkin, looks up at you from his seat in from of a sprawling map of the Dragonspire Valley. With a wave of his hand, he pauses a discussion with his legionnaire commanders, who file out of the room. Primurgos gets to his feet and salutes you, before saying, "I salute you, comrade [t]. The Lord Protector has informed me of your \b\ulservices\b0\ul0 rendered unto the Drakkari people."
Say "services" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos continues, "Yes, it pains me to say it, but in the last 1000 years, I have observed the slow decline of my people. Despite the richness of our wisdom and mastery of our realm, our race is more closely aligned with the fates of our Gods than yours is to your pantheon. The blood of \cf8 Kavra\cf2  in our veins is both boon and \b\ulburden\b0\ul0."
Say "burden" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos folds his arms and nods. "Since the Sundering of our pantheon, dragonkin has diminished in ways imperceptible to many, at least here in the heart of our lands. Elsewhere, I hear rumors of our former colonies being reduced to a shade of their former selves... mere lizardmen. I will not allow this fate to \b\ulbefall\b0\ul0 the rest of my kind."
Say "befall" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos closes his eyes, deep in thought. When he opens them again, you see fire deep within. He speaks with an undertone of anger, "Yes, I will do all within my power to prevent this from happening. But while the Council of Elders works on a solution, I have a more immediate \b\ulproblem\b0\ul0 that I believe you may be able to help with."
Say "problem" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos walks over to a magnificent coat of Drakkari arms and gestures proudly. "This is my battle armor, a relic of a forgotten age. It is the last of its kind, save one worn by the Lord Protector himself. There are magicks woven into it that even our best armorers and blacksmiths cannot \b\ulreproduce\b0\ul0 today."
Say "reproduce" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos continues, looking at you, "But I see that some of these magicks are woven into your equipment! I think there is much knowledge and lost wisdom that we can exchange between dragonkin and humankind, if you are so \b\ulwilling\b0\ul0."
Say "willing" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Primurgos grins widely and claps you on the back with a resounding thud, "Excellent! That's just what I like to hear from a good soldier. Your first priority will be to obtain a piece of heavy equipment for our forward ranks that can boost their mastery of battle. Bring it to me and I will give it to my blacksmiths to study."

Primurgos turns to a safe in the back of his office and unlocks it with an ornate golden key. He opens it to reveal a lantern within, and takes it out. It immediately sputters to life with a \cf16 cold\cf2  but brilliant flame. He shakes your hand with a firm grasp, gives you the lantern, and says, "This is a Lantern of Godfire, bestowed upon those who render great service unto their people. I was granted this in ages past, but \cf11 Diamandia\cf2  has not seen fit to grant a dragonkin audience for a long time. Since she granted you passage through her temple, I thought that you might find more use for this. May you find her favor."
Steps: Give Ancient Emerald Chestplate to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Give Breastplate of Damnation to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Give Diabolic Studded Cowl to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Give Mask of Insight to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Give Warstaff of Dusk to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Give Sassaren Heavy Shield to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos
Say "fulfilled" to Drakkari Battlesmith Primurgos

Name: An Exchange of Sorcery
RequiredClass: Priest Wizard Enchanter Summoner Necromancer Druid
Objectives: Say "learn" to First Archon Eleron

The First Archon Eleron rests in his sanctum, meditating in mid-air above an opulent dais. He opens his green eyes as you approach and floats down to the ground to greet you. With a slight smile, he says, "We finally meet, [t]. I saw you approach from afar in a \b\ulvision\b0\ul0, cresting the southern ridge through the Serpenlux Pass. I informed the Lord Protector but... well it's no matter. You are here now."
Say "vision" to First Archon Eleron

Eleron gazes away momentarily, then collects himself, and says, "Yes, some Drakkari are gifted with \cf9 Thanduril\cf2 's touch, and receive visions as he \b\ulslumbers\b0\ul0. The Drakkamar's connection to him is what gives us our link to the arcane, and as First Archon that link is immensely strong - as are the visions."
Say "slumbers" to First Archon Eleron

Eleron nods, "Indeed, some say the sleeping god \cf9 Thanduril\cf2 's dreams anchor our reality. But we have long lost contact with his sanctum, and the visions grow more profound with each passing year. I fear that something disturbs his slumber, but my efforts to discern the cause have come to naught. It is difficult to admit, but since the Sundering of our pantheon an age ago, all Drakkamar \b\ulmagic\b0\ul0 has waned, mine included."
Say "magic" to First Archon Eleron

Eleron smiles weakly and says, "But maybe this is something you can help us with, [t]. It would be a great service done if you would be willing to \b\ulprocure\b0\ul0 items imbued with powerful magic from outside the Protectorate, where the influence of our pantheon is strongest. Perhaps studying your magic will hold the answer to the questions I must investigate."
Say "procure" to First Archon Eleron

Eleron ventures a wider smile, and says, "Excellent. Our ancient texts write of a gown laced with divine magic that imbue the wearer with a surge of magical power, but we have never discovered such an artifact within the reach of the Protectorate. Perhaps it exists in your Majestic Empire."

Eleron signals you to wait as he channels a massive amount of spirit to maipulate the space around the dais on which he meditates, finally revealing a hidden set of steps. He descends, and returns minutes later with a lantern in hand, burning with a \cf16 cold\cf2  but brilliant flame. He hands the lanterns to you carefully, saying, "This is a Lantern of Godfire, given only to those powerful enough to withstand its magical pressure and who have rendered great services unto the Drakkari people. I bestow this upon you, but whether it will be of use, I know not - it depends on whether \cf11 Diamandia\cf2  will see you. Go with her blessing."
Steps: Give Venerable Raiment Gown to First Archon Eleron
Give Crystal Mage Plate to First Archon Eleron
Give Diabolic Mittens to First Archon Eleron
Give Exquisite Dreamscape Edge to First Archon Eleron
Give Enchanted Precision Mace to First Archon Eleron
Give Diamondlink Crown to First Archon Eleron
Say "work" to First Archon Eleron

Name: Lesson Preparation
Objectives: Say "lessons" to A Dragonkin Headmistress
The headmistress greets you warmly, "Why hello! Were you taking a look at our \b\ulschool\b0\ul0? We take pride in our curriculum here in Drakkarloch."
Say "school" to A Dragonkin Headmistress

The headmistress's eyes light up as she thinks of an idea. Enthusiastically, she say, "This is perfect! Maybe you could help us out with something? We've just run out of some stocks for our natural remedy classes. Would you be \b\ulhappy\b0\ul0 to help obtain more?"
Say "happy" to A Dragonkin Headmistress

The headmistress smiles widely and says, "Great! I'll leave it to you then. We're in need of \b\ulAboral Salve\b0\ul0s, \b\ulOlivaceous Ointment\b0\ul0s, \b\ulTear Filled Draught\b0\ul0s, \b\ulMountain Pine Incense\b0\ul0s, and \b\ulMandragora Root Draught\b0\ul0s. Please bring me 10 of each, thank you very much!"

The headmistress beams as you hand her the final potion. With a wide smile, she says, "Thank you so much for your help with our lesson preparations, [t]. You really are a true friend of the Drakkari! Here, I prepared a gift to thank you for your help. We no longer use these in our smithing classes - apparently they're not good for childrens' growth!"

Name: The Lord of the Lake
Objectives: Say "approach" to Master Spearfisher Kevran

At the southern end of Drakkarloch, you find a tall dragonkin standing on the edge of a cliff overlooking the headwaters of river Ephyrex, as it rushes into the lake on either side of the island city. As you approach, he turns and notices you. He eyes open in surprise for a moment at the sight of a non-dragonkin face, but he quickly composes himself and says, "Well, hello there! That's something you don't see everyday! I'm Kevran, what's your \b\ulname\b0\ul0?"
Say "name" to Master Spearfisher Kevran
The dragonkin replies, "[t]? Did I get that right? Well, welcome to Drakkarloch, [t]! Say, do you know how to \b\ulfish\b0\ul0, where you come from?"
Say "fish" to Master Spearfisher Kevran

Kevran nods excitedly, "Yes, only the best sport in all of Kaldana. Tell me, are you considered a \b\ulskilled\b0\ul0 angler? You must be very keen, to have made the effort to sneak onto these private fishing grounds." Kevran winks knowingly.
Say "skilled" to Master Spearfisher Kevran
Kevran chuckles and says, "Is that so? Well confidence is half the battle, I suppose. Say, how about a \b\ulwager\b0\ul0, you and I?"
Say "wager" to Master Spearfisher Kevran

Kevran grins, "That's what I like to hear. In these waters dwells a shimmerfish that has lived for well over a 100 years. It is both strong and cunning, and has taken many an angler down. We know it as the \b\ulLord of the Lake\b0\ul0 - the undisputed free ruler of these waters."
Say "lord of the lake" to Master Spearfisher Kevran

Kevran continues, "Find the Lord of the Lake and bring me proof of your encounter. If you can do this, I'll be happy to reward you. I'll even give you an access key to these grounds so you can stop sneaking around!"

After you regale Kevran with the story of how you faced the Lord of the Lake and survived to tell the tale, he looks impressed with you. He pulls out a key from his pocket, hands it to you and says, "Color me impressed, [t]. Well done! Here, just as I promised - this will give you legitimate access to my private angling grounds. And I'd also like you to have this." Kevran walks over to a cart containing his equipment, and pulls out a fishing rod, handing it to you. "This was the first rod I ever used. I'd like you to have it. Use it well - maybe next time the Lord of the Lake won't get away!"
Steps: Give Gigantic Shimmerscale to Master Spearfisher Kevran

Name: The Serpent Queen
Objectives: Say "avantir" to Avantir the Anointed

The priest Avantir, ancient even by the standards of the other Elders you have met so far, meditates in a corner of the Halls of Remembrance. You wait for him to notice your presence, which he does after awhile. Opening his golden eyes, he smiles at you and greets you in a crystal clear voice, "Welcome, child of Aran. I am Avantir, leader of this Pristine \b\ulTemple\b0\ul0. First Archon Eleron did say you would be coming."
Say "temple" to Avantir the Anointed

Avantir gets up from his seat and waves his attendants away. "Come, [t]. Let us \b\ulwalk\b0\ul0 the Halls of Remembrance. This is a hallowed place, fit for the things we must discuss. The temple was not built by dragonkin hands, but raised from the ground by Lady \cf8 Kavra\cf2  herself when she breathed her essence into the first of us."

Avantir takes the crystalline tear with reverence, and kneels to begin a prayer, channeling divine energy through the tear. Steadily it glows brighter with an extraterrestrial glow, before suddenly igniting into brilliant embers. The tear floats midair, but doesn't seem to consume itself even as it continues to burn with a \cf16 cold\cf2  flame. Then a silky voice speaks directly into your minds, "\cf11 \bMy children, it is time. You must undo the Sundering, or all will be lost. Seek out my sisters and brothers. Avantir, we will not speak again until all is made whole once more, lest my mind be contaminated by that which ails my sister.\cf2 \b0". The tear \cf9 *collapses*\cf2  in on itself, as Avantir and you stare at each other, speechless.
Steps: Say "walk" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "familiar" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "omen" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "commune" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "gods" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "problem" to Avantir the Anointed
Give \cf16 Starlit Tear\cf2  to Avantir the Anointed

Name: The Skysong Wyvern
Objectives: Say "kavra" to Avantir the Anointed

Avantir is deep in thought, but eventually looks at you and says, "We have been charged with a sacred task by the Lady \cf11 Diamandia\cf2 . Somehow, we must undo the Sundering - but what does that even mean? This feels like a task for \b\ulgods\b0\ul0!"
Say "gods" to Avantir the Anointed

Avantir shakes his head quickly and mutters a prayer, before continuing, "No, I cannot let my faith waver. Lady \cf11 Diamandia\cf2  must have a plan for us all. Our first task is to seek out her brothers and sisters. I suppose the easiest to start with would have to be the \cf8 Skysinger Kavra\cf2  - at least we are still able to visit her, although I don't know how we will be able to \b\ulcommunicate\b0\ul0 with her in her current state. Well, we have to try."
Say "communicate" to Avantir the Anointed

Avantir eyes light up at an idea. Excitedly, he says, "Using a divine focus worked for Lady \cf11 Diamandia\cf2 , so maybe the same will for her sister \cf8 Kavra\cf2  as well! [t], please visit her in Dragonspire Peak where she rests, and bring me something that will enable us to reach her inner mind."

\cf8 Kavra\cf2 's voice fades, and the crystal comes to a rest, diminishing in brightness before cracking through its core. Avantir slumps backwards in exhaustion from the effort of maintaining the divine connection, and says to you, "Well... that was something. Now all we have to do is find a sanctum that cannot be found."
Steps: Give \cf8 Crystallized Song\cf2  to Avantir the Anointed
Say "speak" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "unwell" to Avantir the Anointed
Say "slumber" to Avantir the Anointed

Name: Road to Riches
Objectives: Say "drink" to Freleck
Freleck gulps the last of his drink and says, "Ooo lad if you're buying I'll never say no. Pull up a pew and maybe we can talk a little \b\ulbusiness\b0\ul0.
Say "business" to Freleck

Freleck taps the stool next to him and whispers, "If you're interested in earning a pretty penny, I have just the job for a strapping fellow such as yourself. My brother \b\ulBregrel\b0\ul0 and I attempted to rob the vaults in Epiach Bank recently and well.. it didn't exactly go as planned.
Say "bregrel" to Freleck

Freleck takes another swig of his drink, "Aye my brother and I had scoped the bank for months, putting together the perfect plan. Unfortunately on the day, to calm my nerves I had one too many ales and almost got myself caught, so now my brother is \b\ulstranded\b0\ul0 in the underground vault.
Say "stranded" to Freleck

Freleck sighs, "Yes, he managed to pose as a weathly lord looking to store away some valuable items. He's waiting for me to return and break ito the \b\ulvaults\b0\ul0, but I'm not in a fit state as you can see."
Say "vaults" to Freleck

Freleck whispers in your ear, "Yes, below the bank there are 4 vaults, each with unimaginable riches to be had. If you're willing to join in for a share in the spoils, you'd need to disguise as a potential customer and go speak to my brother and see what he suggests. But to do that though we're going to need to get you some fake identification papers and those don't come cheap! Each set will cost you a \cf14 Silver Bar\cf2 . If you bring me one, I'll know you're serious. I have a guy that can get new papers drawn up straight away so hurry!
Freleck yells as you head out of the Inn, "Maybe don't tell my brother you met me in the inn yea? And good luck!"
Steps: Give Silver Bar to Freleck

Name: The Heist
Objectives: Say "freleck" to Bregrel

Bregrel says, "My brother sent you? And you've managed to get down here undetected? Well then, yes.. maybe you can help. Our plan was solid until Freleck decided to drink his weight in ale.. Anyway, down here there are four vaults all with a mass of riches inside, but we need to be \b\ulmethodical\b0\ul0 on how we get into them. You're going to need a specialized team to have a chance of success.
Say "methodical" to Bregrel

Bregrel says, "That's right! We have to open them in sequence or the doors will seal shut. Firstly, let me tell you about this place a little more. The space itself was designed by Dwarven smiths who collaberated with gnomish tinkerers from the Workshop to provide state of the art Vault mechanism. The area consists of four main vaults, containing some of the realm's most valuable items. In the central corridoor, there's an Arcane Flare that patrols the area.. bumping into that would mean \cf1 DEATH\cf2 . The first \b\ulvault\b0\ul0 we need to enter is the one in the centre."
Bregrel smiles with glee, "Thank you [t]! Who said there's no honour among thieves? Let's do it again sometime."

Name: The Veratine Empire
Objectives: Say "milestone" to Gehazl the Sage

Gehazl looks up and says "What timing [t]. I have just reached a milestone in my research. Yes, yes, indeed. Have you by chance come across any \b\ulVeratine\b0\ul0 Soul Fragments in your adventures?"
Say "veratine" to Gehazl the Sage

Gehazl's eyes sparkle at the sound of this and says, "Yes the very same! Over 2000 years ago there was a great battle waged upon the great city of Serpolis, the home of the Veratine Empire. That place is only a home to vile demons now, but there was a time... yes, there was a \b\ultime\b0\ul0."
Say "time" to Gehazl the Sage

Gehazl says, "Well, no use ringing your ears out telling you. Even better. I can show you exactly how it was! Ah hah, yes! The Fragments you can often find in this world contain great power within that is just lying dormant. I have found the way to utilize this power through my many years of studying these marvelous \b\ulfragments\b0\ul0."
Say "fragments" to Gehazl the Sage

Gehazl seems lost in thought for a brief moment before continuing, "Yes [t]. The Fragments themselves contain faint traces of the overwhelming magics that destroyed this mighty Empire itself. Through my more recent experiments I have discovered a means of pulling the Fragments back to the source of the calamity that created them in the first place. Or at least, some time around this period. I can't believe it myself and I discovered it. You may just have a chance to \b\ulsee\b0\ul0 Serpolis as it once was, in all of it's former glory!"
Say "see" to Gehazl the Sage
Gehazl's smile slowly turns into a frown as he says, "Well. If you can manage to gather at least 50 of such fragments for me to conduct a further \b\ultest\b0\ul0 upon."
Say "test" to Gehazl the Sage
Gehazl lets out a joyful snort and resumes his research.

Gehazl reaches a hand toward you carrying a sort of necklace. He smiles again and says, "This should work nicely. I hope at least. Please, try to activate the magics in this stone and tell me about your experiences upon your return."
Steps: Give Veratine Soul Fragment x50 to Gehazl the Sage
